title: 110_hr6901
content: The Act titled "Meth Free Families and Communities Act" amends the Public Health Service Act to enhance health care provider awareness of methamphetamine addiction by collaborating with professionals in the addiction field and primary health care providers to raise awareness about recognizing substance abuse disorders and applying evidence-based practices for screening and treating individuals with or at-risk for addiction. RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT PROGRAMS FOR PREGNANT AND PARENTING WOMEN. Section 508 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include parenting women in substance abuse treatment programs, allowing for outpatient services and referrals for necessary hospital and dental care. The amendment to Section 508 of the Public Health Service Act includes provisions for outpatient services, referrals for hospital and dental care, and prioritizing programs in rural or health professional shortage areas for pregnant and parenting women in low-income households and health disparity populations. The amendment to Section 508 of the Public Health Service Act addresses shortages of mental health professionals and family-based substance abuse treatment options in high addiction areas, with updated reporting requirements. The amendment to Section 508 of the Public Health Service Act requires reports to include evaluations, data on pregnant and parenting women in need of substance abuse treatment, and recovery rates of women in treatment programs. The amendment to Section 508 of the Public Health Service Act expands efforts to provide treatment for pregnant and parenting women with methamphetamine addiction or other drug dependencies, including data on health disparity populations. The amendment to Section 508 of the Public Health Service Act increases funding for fiscal years 2009 through 2013 to address health disparities and provide treatment for pregnant and parenting women with methamphetamine addiction or other drug dependencies. SEC. 4 amends Section 515(b) of the Public Health Service Act to develop a clearinghouse for drug-free workplace information. SEC. 5 introduces a student-driven methamphetamine awareness project. SEC. 5 amends the Public Health Service Act to include a student-driven methamphetamine awareness project, involving adult mentors and professionals in creating public service announcements.
